glsa.title: l2tpd: Buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow in l2tpd could lead to remote code execution. It is not known whether this bug is exploitable.

background.p: l2tpd is a GPL implentation of the Layer 2 Tunneling Protocol.

description.p: Thomas Walpuski discovered a buffer overflow that may be exploitable by sending a specially crafted packet. In order to exploit the vulnerable code, an attacker would need to fake the establishment of an L2TP tunnel.

impact.p: A remote attacker may be able to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running l2tpd.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround for this vulnerability.

resolution.p: All users are recommended to upgrade to the latest stable version:
